meanings.definition: The act of injecting a substance into the body.
meanings.sent1: The nurse gave the patient an injection to help him feel better.
meanings.sent2: After the injection, the pain started to fade away.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a disappearing coin and a mysterious injection.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a powerful injection of confidence into his doubts.
meanings.sent5: The injection of color into the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: A shot or dose of a substance injected into the body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor administered an injection to treat the illness.
meanings.sent2: He winced slightly as the injection was given.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party had a surprise: a cake with an injection of extra sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The music was an injection of energy that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent5: The injection of flavor made the dish irresistible.

meanings.definition: The process of introducing a new element or factor into a situation.
meanings.sent1: The injection of humor into the conversation lightened the mood.
meanings.sent2: Her suggestion was like an injection of creativity into the project.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist was an injection of excitement for the audience.
meanings.sent4: His arrival was an injection of chaos into their carefully planned day.
meanings.sent5: The new technology was an injection of efficiency into the old system.
